AssessmentItem.Content:
More and more of the world’s population are living in towns or cities. The speed at which cities are growing in the less developed countries is (_1_) . Between 1920 and 1960 big cities in developed countries (_2_) two and a half times in size, but in other parts of the world the growth was eight times their size.
　　The  (_3_) size of growth is bad enough, but there are now also very (_4_) signs of trouble in the (_5_) of percentages of people living in towns and percentages of people working in industry.
